content.text:
[cron:8b380d56-7314-4ba9-b4c4-ea11d3e5ca6f PR Review Patrol (High Frequency)] PR patrol for bills-bot.

Repo: /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot/

⚠️ CRITICAL RULE: Only check PRs authored by Bill (BillChirico) or by Pip Build / sub-agents. Do NOT check, fix, or address PRs from anyone else (other contributors, bots like coderabbitai, dependabot[bot], renovate[bot]) unless Bill has explicitly told you to.

Do this each run:
1) List open PRs in BillChirico/bills-bot.
2) Filter to ONLY Bill's PRs and Pip Build's PRs. Skip everything else.
3) For eligible PRs, count unresolved review threads.
4) If no unresolved threads on eligible PRs: respond exactly `NO_REPLY`.
5) If unresolved threads exist:
   - Spawn ONE sub-agent PER PR (parallel), never batch PRs together.
   - Use agentId `build`, model `anthropic/claude-opus-4-6`, thinking `high`.
   - Include full unresolved thread details (thread id, file path, line, issue summary).
   - Instruct spawned agents to read and follow CODING.md, fix all review comments (including nitpicks unless nonsensical/breaking/redundant), run tests/coverage, resolve threads.
   - Instruct spawned agents NOT to post PR summary comments unless Bill explicitly asks.
   - Have spawned agents report completion summary back to parent agent.
   - After spawning, send Bill a concise Discord DM status update:
     - channel: discord
     - target: user:191633014441115648
     - accountId: pip-build
     - include PR numbers and unresolved thread counts.
6) If any spawned run fails/stalls, note it in DM and respawn once.

Keep updates concise and action-oriented.
Current time: Tuesday, February 17th, 2026 — 4:07 AM (America/New_York)

content.thinking:
**Initiating PR Patrol**

I've been instructed to perform a PR patrol for the `bills-bot` repository. My initial step, as directed, was to read the provided `MEMORY.md` and related memory files. Now, I'm proceeding to generate a list of all currently open pull requests.

arguments.command: cd /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot && gh pr list --state open --json number,title,author,headRefName --jq '.[] | select(.author.login == "BillChirico" or .author.login == "PipBuild" or .author.login == "pip-build")'

content.text: {"author":{"id":"MDQ6VXNlcjEzOTUxMzE2","is_bot":false,"login":"BillChirico","name":"Bill Chirico"},"headRefName":"feat/rest-api","number":70,"title":"feat: REST API layer for web dashboard"}

details.aggregated: {"author":{"id":"MDQ6VXNlcjEzOTUxMzE2","is_bot":false,"login":"BillChirico","name":"Bill Chirico"},"headRefName":"feat/rest-api","number":70,"title":"feat: REST API layer for web dashboard"}

arguments.command:
PR_NUM=70
REPO_OWNER="BillChirico"
REPO_NAME="bills-bot"

# Function to get unresolved threads with pagination
get_unresolved_threads() {
  local pr_num=$1
  local cursor=""
  local total_unresolved=0
  local threads_json="[]"

  while true; do
    if [ -z "$cursor" ]; then
      QUERY="{repository(owner:\"$REPO_OWNER\",name:\"$REPO_NAME\"){pullRequest(number:$pr_num){reviewThreads(first:100){pageInfo{hasNextPage endCursor} nodes{id isResolved path line diffSide originalLine originalCommit{oid} comments(first:1){nodes{body}}}}}}}"
    else
      QUERY="{repository(owner:\"$REPO_OWNER\",name:\"$REPO_NAME\"){pullRequest(number:$pr_num){reviewThreads(first:100,after:\"$cursor\"){pageInfo{hasNextPage endCursor} nodes{id isResolved path line diffSide originalLine originalCommit{oid} comments(first:1){nodes{body}}}}}}}"
    fi

    RESULT=$(gh api graphql -f query="$QUERY")
    
    # Extract unresolved nodes and append to list
    UNRESOLVED_NODES=$(echo "$RESULT" | jq -c '.data.repository.pullRequest.reviewThreads.nodes | map(select(.isResolved == false))')
    threads_json=$(echo "$threads_json $UNRESOLVED_NODES" | jq -s 'add')
    
    HAS_NEXT=$(echo "$RESULT" | jq -r '.data.repository.pullRequest.reviewThreads.pageInfo.hasNextPage')
    if [ "$HAS_NEXT" = "true" ]; then
      cursor=$(echo "$RESULT" | jq -r '.data.repository.pullRequest.reviewThreads.pageInfo.endCursor')
    else
      break
    fi
  done
  echo "$threads_json"
}

get_unresolved_threads $PR_NUM
